post.description: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

parameters.description: Subscription configuration for the REST Gateway (response schema will be delivered async over the configured stream)
parameters.name: body

fromBlock.description: The block number to start the subscription from

stream.description: The ID of an event stream already configured in the REST Gateway

parameters.description: Subscription configuration for the REST Gateway (response schema will be delivered async over the configured stream)
parameters.name: body

fromBlock.description: The block number to start the subscription from

stream.description: The ID of an event stream already configured in the REST Gateway

post.description: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

parameters.description: Subscription configuration for the REST Gateway (response schema will be delivered async over the configured stream)
parameters.name: body

fromBlock.description: The block number to start the subscription from

stream.description: The ID of an event stream already configured in the REST Gateway

parameters.name: body

parameters.name: body

post.description: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

parameters.description: Subscription configuration for the REST Gateway (response schema will be delivered async over the configured stream)
parameters.name: body

fromBlock.description: The block number to start the subscription from

stream.description: The ID of an event stream already configured in the REST Gateway

get.description: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

post.description: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

get.description: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

post.description: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

get.description: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

post.description: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

get.description: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

post.description: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

get.description: Returns the name of the token.

post.description: Returns the name of the token.

get.description: Returns the address of the current owner.

post.description: Returns the address of the current owner.

get.description: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

post.description: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

get.description: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

post.description: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

get.description: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

post.description: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

get.description: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

post.description: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

get.description: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

post.description: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

acktypeParam.description: Set to 'receipt' to store a receipt before acknowledging an async request (header: x-kaleido-acktype)
acktypeParam.name: kld-acktype

blocknumberParam.description: The target block number for eth_call requests. One of 'earliest/latest/pending', a number or a hex string (header: x-kaleido-blocknumber)
blocknumberParam.name: kld-blocknumber

callParam.description: Perform a read-only call with the same parameters that would be used to invoke, and return result (header: x-kaleido-call)
callParam.name: kld-call

gasParam.description: Gas to send with the transaction (auto-calculated if not set) (header: x-kaleido-gas)
gasParam.name: kld-gas

idParam.description: Optionally set the ID for this request - must be unique if set (header: x-kaleido-id)
idParam.name: kld-id

privateForParam.description: Private transaction recipients (comma separated or multiple params) (header: x-kaleido-privatefor)
privateForParam.name: kld-privatefor

registerParam.description: Register the installed contract on a friendly path (overwrites existing) (header: x-kaleido-register)
registerParam.name: kld-register

syncParam.description: Block the HTTP request until the tx is mined (does not store the receipt) (header: x-kaleido-sync)
syncParam.name: kld-sync

transactionParam.description: Query the details for the provided transaction hash (header: x-kaleido-transaction)
transactionParam.name: kld-transaction

valueParam.description: Ether value to send with the transaction (header: x-kaleido-ethvalue)
valueParam.name: kld-ethvalue
